meanings.definition: To bend or twist out of shape
meanings.sent1: The heat was warping the plastic toy.
meanings.sent2: The wooden door was warping due to humidity.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat was warping the truth with its playful antics.
meanings.sent4: Time seemed to be warping around him as he waited for the train.
meanings.sent5: The artist's brushstrokes were warping the once straight lines into a beautiful abstract painting.

meanings.sent1: The old photograph was warping with age.
meanings.sent2: The metal frame was warping under the weight of the heavy load.
meanings.sent3: The magician's trick left the audience wondering if reality was warping before their eyes.
meanings.sent4: Her memories were warping over time, becoming more fantastical with each retelling.
meanings.sent5: The music was warping in and out of focus, creating a mesmerizing effect.

meanings.definition: The action of warping or the state of being warped
meanings.sent1: The warping of the wood was evident in the curved shape of the boat.
meanings.sent2: The fabric showed signs of warping from being stretched too tightly.
meanings.sent3: The comedy show had the audience in stitches with its hilarious take on the warping of reality.
meanings.sent4: The warping of time in the sci-fi movie made for an intriguing plot twist.
meanings.sent5: The warping of the space-time continuum was a central theme in the science fiction novel.
